Module java.math
Package jama2

Class QRDecomposition

  • java.lang.Object
    • jama2.QRDecomposition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class QRDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    QR Decomposition.

    For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the QR decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix Q and an n-by-n upper triangular matrix R so that A = Q*R.

    The QR decompostion always exists, even if the matrix does not have full rank, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the QR decomposition is in the least squares solution of nonsquare systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if isFullRank() returns false.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    The MathWorks, Inc. and the National Institute of Standards and Technology.
    See Also:
    java-matrix, Serialized Form

      • solve

        public Matrix solve​(Matrix B)
        Least squares solution of A*X = B
        Parameters:
        B - A Matrix with as many rows as A and any number of columns.
        Returns:
        Returns null if row dimensions don't agree or matris is rang deficient. Returns X that minimizes the two norm of Q*R*X-B Matrix row otherwise.
